column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Erlian
#Text=Erlian ( 二连 ; Èrlián ) is a city in Inner Mongolia .
#Text=It is also variously known as Ereen or Eriyen in Mongolia , and Erenhot or Erlianhaote ( 二连浩特 ; Èrliánhàotè ) in China .
#Text=It appears as Erlian on Chinese railway timetables , and Ereen on Monglian railway timetables .
#Text=By plane
#Text=There is a direct flight Beijing-Erlian ( Erenhot Shi , code ERL ) via Capital Airlines , China .
#Text=From Erlian to Hohhot
#Text=a 40-minute flight was just over ¥ 170 ( Sep 2016 ) .
#Text=By train
#Text=There are trains from Beijing .
#Text=The train station is on the eastern border of the town .
#Text=Tickets can be purchased at the station 20 days in advance , or from almost any tourist/travel center 5 days in advance .
#Text=Prices are controlled by the government and there should only be a ¥ 10 commission on the sale if you buy it from a 3rd party agent .
#Text=Train #K23 departs from Beijing at 11:22 arriving in Erlian at 22:30 shared hard berth ¥ 200 ( March 2016 ) .
#Text=You can get from Zamiin-Uud in Mongolia to Erlian by train on the international train from Beijing to Ulaanbaatar as described in Zamiin-Uud .
#Text=From Moscow and other major Russian cities along the track , you can take the weekly train 43 , aka the " Trans-Mongolian " , to Erlian .
#Text=Visa run
#Text=Trains to Beijing only run a few days a week .
#Text=If you are doing a visa run from Beijing , find out when trains will be coming back before going to Erlian .
#Text=Train tickets can typically be purchased at the train station five days before the train is scheduled to leave , ten days during Chinese New Year ( 2010 ) .
#Text=If you are traveling from Beijing to renew a visa , return tickets can not be purchased in Beijing .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There are sleeper buses from Beijing .
#Text=The long-distance bus station is nearby , about one block west and 2-3 blocks north of the train station .
#Text=You can take a bus from Hohhot .
#Text=There are several buses each day for ¥ 95 ( 2017 ) .
#Text=Depending on the traffic the trip is about 6 hours and 30 minutes .
#Text=Bus stops for the driver to eat , but there is not much choice so bring some snacks .
#Text=You can get from Zamiin-Uud train center in Mongolia by bus ( ¥ 40 , July 2009 ) .
#Text=The bus station was closed for Chinese New Year until Feb 19 ( 2010 ) .
#Text=By jeep
#Text=You can get from Zamiin-Uud in Mongolia by jeep , which costs around ¥ 50 per person ( July 2009 ) .
#Text=Russian-made jeeps driven by Mongolian drivers start at the market where Mongolians buy goods to take back to Mongolia .
#Text=The same jeeps also pick up passengers at the first border checkpoint with Chinese guards if they have room .
#Text=At the border a jeep will arrive every few minutes .
#Text=A Chinese taxi can take you to this checkpoint for ¥ 5 - 10.
#Text=The jeeps are allowed to carry 5 passengers ; however , some drivers ask the Chinese guards for exceptions and carry up to 7 passengers .
#Text=If taking a jeep , expect to be very crowded and to either sit on someone 's lap or have someone sit on your lap .
#Text=Get out of the jeep at the Chinese and Mongolian entry points and walk through .
#Text=Be sure to remember which jeep is yours as they come in only two colors ( grey and green ) and look nearly identical to each other .
#Text=Many Mongolians cross the border on a daily basis so they are familiar with the process and can help out .
#Text=Many speak at least some English .
#Text=You are not allowed to walk between the Chinese and Mongolian border posts though they are within walking distance .
#Text=You will need to pay a ¥ 5 exit tax .
#Text=The whole process takes around 1½ hours .
#Text=On some holidays ( e.g. 1 June , Children 's Day ) , the border is closed and you may be forced to stay a day longer than prepared .
#Text=It may happen that a driver still offers you a lift , then notices at the border that it is n't possible and still wants to charge you for it .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Taxis , pedicabs and rickshaws are everywhere .
#Text=A taxi around town costs ¥ 5 flat rate or ¥ 10 to the border from town ( February 2010 ) .
#Text=The number one bus also will take you from town to the border for ¥ 1 .
#Text=See
#Text=Dinosaur Museum ( 7 km from the centre of Erlian ) .
#Text=This is a cool attraction and outdoor park .
#Text=There are several exhibits and large outdoor gardens .
#Text=It takes 2-4 hours to see all the exhibits and gardens .
#Text=To get to the museum a taxi will cost around ¥ 40 one way or ¥ 100 to have the taxi wait for you and take you both ways .
#Text=( Konlongmudi ) .
#Text=Large replicas of dinosaur skeletons
#Text=Sculpture .
#Text=There is a giant at the intersection of the main roads - one running east-west from the train station , the other north-south .
#Text=Dinosaur Plaza ( Towards the center of town ) .
#Text=There is a large plaza near the center of town that was under construction ( 2017 ) .
#Text=There looks like there is potential for a nice plaza with a dinosaur theme .
#Text=There is loads of shopping all around .
#Text=There was a fair in the plaza ( July 2017 ) .
#Text=Several street barbecues set up every night just south of the plaza .
#Text=Do
#Text=Erlian Grassland Tour Loop .
#Text=It is possible to use Erlian as the starting point for the Erlian Grassland Tour Loop itinerary .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Antiques ( of suspect age ) and touristy knickknacks , at the alleys of gift shops at the north-east corner of 新华街 ( mislabeled as Xinghua Street ) and 前进路 ( Qianjin Road ) .
#Text=Central Market ( The market can be found directly across the street from the dinosaur square . ) .
#Text=There is a large indoor market with many small shops selling all sorts of goods from clothes to power tools .
#Text=There are also many outdoor stores next to the market .
#Text=There are many large shopping centers in the area also .
#Text=There are money changers at the east entrance who will give you a decent exchange rate for Mongolian money if needed .
#Text=Eat
#Text=The Mongolian restaurant in the bus station complex ( on the left side ) has excellent food with reasonable prices and a picture menu .
#Text=They also have some imported items from Mongolia and ¥ 1 lockers if you do n't want to lug your bag around .
#Text=Most of the clientele are Mongolians and many of the waitstaff do n't speak Mandarin so you know it 's authentic !
#Text=There are also Muslim restaurants opened by the Hui Muslims of China .
#Text=There are many barbecue places on Xilin street that set up outside dinning and start getting busy around 19:30 .
